text: The expression of <extra_id_0> tissue factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , the principal initiator of coagulation , is increased during inflammation and atherosclerosis .

text: Both conditions are promoted by lysophosphatidylcholine ( lysoPC ) .

We observed in the present study that lysoPC ( 1 to 10 micromol / L ) dose-dependently reduced <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity in human monocytes , as elicited by lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) .

text: Lysophosphatidylethanolamine ( lysoPE ) and other lysophospholipids did not affect LPS - induced <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity of human monocytes .

text: <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen expression as elicited by LPS was also lowered by lysoPC .

text: Phospholipid analyses indicated a selective increase in the lysoPC content of the monocytes after preincubation with the lysophospholipid .
LysoPC inhibited the <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity of Mono Mac-6 cells to a similar extent as in the monocytes .
LPS binding to plasma membrane receptors and internalization of LPS into monocytes were not affected by lysoPC .
In contrast , LPS - mediated nuclear binding of nuclear factor-kappaB / Rel to a <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific kappaB site was inhibited by lysoPC .
Induction of <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression by LPS tended to be partially reduced by the lysophospholipid .

text: Preincubation with lysoPC increased monocytic cAMP levels .

Inhibition of adenylyl cyclase by pretreatment with 2'-deoxy-3'-adenosine monophosphate partially reversed the inhibition of <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity promoted by lysoPC .

text: In conclusion , lysoPC markedly decreases LPS - mediated <extra_id_0> TF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression of human monocytes , the effect probably being mediated by both transcriptional and posttranscriptional mechanisms .

text: LysoPC may thus attenuate activation of coagulation during inflammation and atherosclerosis .
